Functionality.comm: Router requires frequent reboots to maintain connection.

cont.entity_a: Linksys products work great initially but may require frequent reboots to maintain functionality. Router occasionally requires rebooting due to DHCP server issues. The device often needs to be reset due to connectivity issues. Router may stop working and require frequent resets.
cont.entity_b: Wireless connection occasionally drops and requires a reboot.

cont.entity_a: The reset button on the device appears non-functional.

Range.comm: Wireless range and strength are limited.

cont.entity_a: The advertised range of 300ft is questionable, with poor signal quality at approximately 80ft. Installation is straightforward and quick, with strong signal reception within 40 feet.
cont.entity_b: Wireless signal strength is strong throughout the house. The wireless range is poor, requiring proximity to maintain a connection. Router has a strong wireless signal and good range.

cont.entity_a: Support was generally good, and setup was easy. Documentation is incomplete and outdated, only covering Windows 98 & ME. Linksys has limited support for Macintosh users. Customer service is unresponsive.
cont.entity_b: D-Link products have poor customer service.

Firmware.comm: Firmware updates are necessary to resolve performance issues.

cont.entity_b: Firmware upgrades are necessary to improve performance.

cont.entity_a: Router lacks advanced configuration options and only supports one IPSec pass-through session.
cont.entity_b: Setup pages are cryptic but manageable. The router has advanced firewall configurations. Router works well with VPN connections.
Router provides good security with 256-bit WEP encryption. Setup and configuration are easy, with good firewall and security features.
D-Link AirPlus offers faster speeds compared to Linksys.

cont.entity_a: The router cannot support more than one Xbox connected to Xbox Live at a time.
